stories.title: Bear: Markdown Notes for iPhone, iPad, and Mac
Apostrophe: A GTK+ based distraction free Markdown editor

stories.text:
Motivation is not usually a problem for founders, per se. But perhaps staying motivated on the "right" thing is (i.e. writing on the truly highest priority task).

How do you stay focused and on track through the many ups and downs of creating a new company/product while being as a solo founder? Is self motivation enough? Peer groups? Do you hire a project manager to help keep you organized? If the latter, tell me more.
stories.title: Ask HN: Staying motivated and organized as a single founder
The Most Deadly Project on the Internet?
Lawsuit claims more Fitbits are burn hazards, includes gross pictures
Yuri Milner's Facebook investment shows 1 founder share = 1.5 employee shares

stories.text:
I have to write these long memos for work but I just can’t seem to sit down to focus and write them. I end up procrastinating to the last minute and then push it out in some type of mad frenzy. It doesn’t feel good but I can’t figure a way through it.

How do you sit down and just turn the focus / execution on like a switch in the brain? For me I’m at the whims of my impulses, but it’s not something I can just switch on when I want. It makes my life really unsustainable.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to work when you’re supposed to?
